Another thing about green in sunlight:  IT IS INVISIBLE!  The black-body heat curve for wavelengths goes from red when cooler (hot coals), through orange to yellow (bright flames) to WHITE (NOT GREEN!!!) for nearly-sun-hot items (hot-forge-ready solid steel, for example) through blue-white (electric arcs and extremely hot liquid metals)   No green, though it is right there in the middle of this range.  The reason?  Green plants.  If you saw the green light in sunlight, it would mask the green of healthy plants (white of sick plants would look green, since it is the brightest part of natural sunlight).  So, for hot-source-black-body light, especially sunlight, green is turned to white to give natural sunlight when going through the sun's temperature range.  Yet, when green is by itself, as in leaves or green traffic lights, you see it fine.  Our senses are NOT giving us the "real deal", but an adjusted input to optimize our survival.  No green stars...
